content:
DropShadowBitmapEffect Class

Definition

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is DropShadowEffect. Applies a shadow behind a visual object at a slight offset. The offset is determined by mimicking a casting shadow from an imaginary light source.

In this Article

public sealed class DropShadowBitmapEffect : System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffect
Inheritance

Animatable

Remarks

Note

WPF bitmap effects are software rendered. Any object that applies an effect will also be rendered in software. Bitmap effects should not be applied to large visuals or animations because this can degrade performance.

Constructors

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is DropShadowEffect. Initializes a new instance of the DropShadowBitmapEffect class.

Properties

Color

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is DropShadowEffect. Gets or sets the color of the shadow.

public System.Windows.Media.Color Color { get; set; }
Value
Color

The color of the shadow. The default value is FF000000 (black).

Remarks

The alpha value of the Color structure is ignored by this property. To set the amount of transparency (alpha) of the color, use the Opacity property.

The following illustration demonstrates the effect of this property.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field ColorProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Direction

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is DropShadowEffect. Gets or sets the angle at which the shadow is cast.

public double Direction { get; set; }
Value
Double

The angle at which the shadow is cast. The valid range of values is from 0 through 360. The value 0 puts the direction immediately to the right of the object. Subsequent values move the direction around the object in a counter-clockwise direction. For example, a value of 90 indicates the shadow is cast directly upward from the object; a value of 180 is cast directly to the left of the object, and so on. The default value is 315.

Remarks

The following diagram shows in which direction the shadow is cast for a given value of this property.

The following illustration demonstrates the effect of this property.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field DirectionProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Noise

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is DropShadowEffect. Gets or sets the graininess, or "noise level," of the shadow.

public double Noise { get; set; }
Value
Double

The noise level of the shadow. The valid range of values is from 0 through 1. A value of 0 indicates no noise and 1 indicates maximum noise. A value of 0.5 indicates 50 percent noise, a value of 0.75 indicates 75 percent noise, and so on. The default value is 0.

Remarks

The following illustration demonstrates the effect of this property.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field NoiseProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Opacity

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is DropShadowEffect. Gets or sets the degree of opacity of the shadow.

public double Opacity { get; set; }
Value
Double

The degree of opacity. The valid range of values is from 0 through 1. A value of 0 indicates that the shadow is completely transparent, and a value of 1 indicates that the shadow is completely opaque. A value of 0.5 indicates the shadow is 50 percent opaque, a value of 0.725 indicates the shadow is 72.5 percent opaque, and so on. Values less than 0 are treated as 0, while values greater than 1 are treated as 1. The default is 1.

Remarks

This property must be used to set the opacity of the DropShadowBitmapEffect because the alpha level component of the Color property is ignored.

The following illustration demonstrates the effect of this property.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field OpacityProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

ShadowDepth

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is DropShadowEffect. Gets or sets the distance between the object and the shadow that it casts.

public double ShadowDepth { get; set; }
Value
Double

The distance between the plane of the object casting the shadow and the shadow plane measured in device-independent units (1/96th inch per unit). The valid range of values is from 0 through 300. The default is 5.

Remarks

The following illustration demonstrates the effect of this property.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field ShadowDepthProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Softness

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is DropShadowEffect. Gets or sets the softness of the shadow.

public double Softness { get; set; }
Value
Double

The shadow's softness. The valid range of values is from 0 through 1. A value of 0.0 indicates no softness (a sharply defined shadow) and 1.0 indicates maximum softness (a very diffused shadow). A value of 0.5 indicates 50 percent softness, a value of 0.75 indicates 75 percent softness, and so on. The default is 0.5.

Remarks

The following illustration demonstrates the effect of this property.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field SoftnessProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Methods

Clone()

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is DropShadowEffect. Creates a modifiable clone of this DropShadowBitmapEffect, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

public System.Windows.Media.Effects.DropShadowBitmapEffect Clone ();
Returns
DropShadowBitmapEffect

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version.

For more information, see Clone.

CloneCurrentValue()

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is DropShadowEffect. Creates a modifiable clone of this DropShadowBitmapEffect object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

public System.Windows.Media.Effects.DropShadowBitmapEffect CloneCurrentValue ();
Returns
DropShadowBitmapEffect

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version.

For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.
